author: Yuthika Bhargava
text:
Telecom Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on Tuesday asked Twitter to ensure that the social media platform was not abused for terrorism and extremism that posed a threat to India.

Twitter said it recently suspended over one lakh accounts globally over such issues.

He also raised the issue of Jammu having been shown as part of Pakistan by the micro-blogging site at the first official meeting on Tuesday between the NDA government’s brass and Twitter, represented by its Global Head for Public Policy Colin Crowell. In a faux pas earlier this month, Twitter’s location tagging service showed Jammu as part of Pakistan, and Jammu and Kashmir in China.

“I formally communicated our deep sense of dismay and disapproval. A greater sensitivity needs to be shown by these platforms as far as our geographical identity and integrity is concerned,” said Mr. Prasad.
title: Prevent abuse by terror elements, Twitter told
